intro: Stigmaphyllon ellipticum var. nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan elliptic stigmaphyllon, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua and surrounding regions. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and produces small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
